issues.title: Elements must only use supported ARIA attributes
issues.description: Ensure an element's role supports its ARIA attributes

all.message: ARIA attribute is not allowed: aria-expanded="false"

nodes.html: <div id="navbarToggle01" class="collapse navbar-collapse" aria-labelledby="navbarColor" data-bs-parent="#navbarNav" style="height: 300px;" aria-expanded="false">
nodes.failureSummary:
Fix all of the following:
  ARIA attribute is not allowed: aria-expanded="false"

issues.title: `[aria-*]` attributes do not match their roles
issues.description: Each ARIA `role` supports a specific subset of `aria-*` attributes. Mismatching these invalidates the `aria-*` attributes. [Learn how to match ARIA attributes to their roles](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/aria-allowed-attr).

node.snippet: <div id="navbarToggle01" class="collapse navbar-collapse" aria-labelledby="navbarColor" data-bs-parent="#navbarNav" style="height: 300px;" aria-expanded="false">
node.nodeLabel:
Home
Contact us
About us
Shopping cart
Profile
node.explanation:
Fix all of the following:
  ARIA attribute is not allowed: aria-expanded="false"

issues.title: ARIA hidden element must not be focusable or contain focusable elements
issues.description: Ensure aria-hidden elements are not focusable nor contain focusable elements

all.message: Focusable content should be disabled or be removed from the DOM

nodes.html: <div class="modal fade" id="exampleModal" tabindex="-1" aria-labelledby="exampleModalLabel" aria-hidden="true">
nodes.failureSummary:
Fix all of the following:
  Focusable content should be disabled or be removed from the DOM

issues.title: `[aria-hidden="true"]` elements contain focusable descendents
issues.description: Focusable descendents within an `[aria-hidden="true"]` element prevent those interactive elements from being available to users of assistive technologies like screen readers. [Learn how `aria-hidden` affects focusable elements](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/aria-hidden-focus).

node.snippet: <div class="modal fade" id="exampleModal" tabindex="-1" aria-labelledby="exampleModalLabel" aria-hidden="true">
node.nodeLabel:

node.explanation:
Fix all of the following:
  Focusable content should be disabled or be removed from the DOM

issues.title: ARIA roles used must conform to valid values
issues.description: Ensure all elements with a role attribute use a valid value

none.message: Role must be one of the valid ARIA roles: searchbar

nodes.failureSummary:
Fix all of the following:
  Role must be one of the valid ARIA roles: searchbar

issues.title: `[role]` values are not valid
issues.description: ARIA roles must have valid values in order to perform their intended accessibility functions. [Learn more about valid ARIA roles](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/aria-roles).

node.explanation:
Fix all of the following:
  Role must be one of the valid ARIA roles: searchbar

any.message: Element does not have inner text that is visible to screen readers
aria-label attribute does not exist or is empty
aria-labelledby attribute does not exist, references elements that do not exist or references elements that are empty
Element does not have an implicit (wrapped) <label>
Element does not have an explicit <label>
Element's default semantics were not overridden with role="none" or role="presentation"

nodes.failureSummary:
Fix any of the following:
  Element does not have inner text that is visible to screen readers
  aria-label attribute does not exist or is empty
  aria-labelledby attribute does not exist, references elements that do not exist or references elements that are empty
  Element has no title attribute
  Element does not have an implicit (wrapped) <label>
  Element does not have an explicit <label>
  Element's default semantics were not overridden with role="none" or role="presentation"

issues.title: This button element does not have a name available to an accessibility API. Valid names are: title undefined, element content, aria-label undefined, aria-labelledby undefined.

original_issue.message: This button element does not have a name available to an accessibility API. Valid names are: title undefined, element content, aria-label undefined, aria-labelledby undefined.
original_issue.selector: html > body > div > header > form > div > div > button

issues.title: Buttons do not have an accessible name
issues.description: When a button doesn't have an accessible name, screen readers announce it as "button", making it unusable for users who rely on screen readers. [Learn how to make buttons more accessible](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/button-name).

node.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  Element does not have inner text that is visible to screen readers
  aria-label attribute does not exist or is empty
  aria-labelledby attribute does not exist, references elements that do not exist or references elements that are empty
  Element has no title attribute
  Element does not have an implicit (wrapped) <label>
  Element does not have an explicit <label>
  Element's default semantics were not overridden with role="none" or role="presentation"

issues.title: Elements should not have tabindex greater than zero
issues.description: Ensure tabindex attribute values are not greater than 0

any.message: Element has a tabindex greater than 0

nodes.html: <input type="text" class="form-control me-2" placeholder="Search" aria-label="Search" aria-describedby="search-addon" tabindex="1">
nodes.failureSummary:
Fix any of the following:
  Element has a tabindex greater than 0

issues.title: Some elements have a `[tabindex]` value greater than 0
issues.description: A value greater than 0 implies an explicit navigation ordering. Although technically valid, this often creates frustrating experiences for users who rely on assistive technologies. [Learn more about the `tabindex` attribute](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/tabindex).

node.snippet: <input type="text" class="form-control me-2" placeholder="Search" aria-label="Search" aria-describedby="search-addon" tabindex="1">
node.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  Element has a tabindex greater than 0

issues.title: This link points to a named anchor "contact" within the document, but no anchor exists with that name.

original_issue.message: This link points to a named anchor "contact" within the document, but no anchor exists with that name.
original_issue.selector: html > body > div > main > div > a

automatic.name: Size; Target Size; Element too small

issues.title: Touch targets do not have sufficient size or spacing.
issues.description: Touch targets with sufficient size and spacing help users who may have difficulty targeting small controls to activate the targets. [Learn more about touch targets](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/target-size).

node.snippet: <button type="button" class="btn btn-primary mt-5" data-bs-toggle="modal" data-bs-target="#exampleModal">
node.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  Target has insufficient size (147.9px by 21px, should be at least 24px by 24px)
  Target has insufficient space to its closest neighbors. Safe clickable space has a diameter of 16.2px instead of at least 24px.
